website_summaries.verdict: In general, those who own the Brooks Addiction Walker enjoyed how comfortable it was. People marveled at how this trainer alleviated discomfort and pain and it was also considered durable and supportive by many.Though a lot of individuals liked the style, there were some who thought otherwise. But in the end, it was considered an effective walking shoe because of its cushiony and steady platform.
pros: A majority of owners described the Brooks Addiction Walker as a very comfortable pair of walking shoes
Many of those who suffer from foot and leg pains claimed that this model relieved discomfort
The footwear was considered durable by numerous testers
The merchandise provided adequate foothold and arch support, as stated by plenty of wearers
The overall design of the product was found stylish by multiple people
More than a few commenters lauded the steadiness of the sole unit
The price of this model was reasonable given its quality build, said several consumers
Some individuals were pleased that the footgear accommodated custom orthotics
cons: A minority of testers ranted that the footwear was heavy and looked clunky
Several reviewers were dismayed that the outsole lacked traction and squeaked
The tongue and the laces were short and did not secure the instep, as commented by a handful of wearers
Some users complained that the interior of the footgear got hot

customer_reviews.title: REVIEW AFTER 5 MONTHS - NEEDING TO REPLACE - RUBBER PEELING
customer_reviews.text: 5 months after purchase - very comfortable but the front rubber is peeling off towards the front at the toe so they get caught going up stairs - disappointing for how expensive they are that I'm looking to get a new pair after only 5 months...
customer_reviews.author: Joe U

customer_reviews.title: Best shoe for Mail carrier
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic shoe... I love it... As a postal worker.. I walk a lot.. These shoes are the best... Highly recommended for anyone that stays on their feet 10hs a day.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nedd comfortable shoes? This ones for you - Especially for us extra wide widths-
customer_reviews.text: These are shoes that keep my plantar fasciitis and knee problems at bay- I needed to add the Dr. Scholl gel inserts for better arch support in place of the factory insole. I wear these every day! Only weak spot is the small toe area ay the crease point- See Photo. My set before this also failed at the same area. - I still have 50 % of the sole left of the shoe and use them as my around the house shoes
customer_reviews.author: D. Long

customer_reviews.title: Nothing good here MoveOn
customer_reviews.text: Not wide, roomy or breathable enough for walking shoes and the midsole does not provide enough cushioning if you want to be on your feet all day. The Black model is quite stiff and digs into your ankles. These remind me of something you might buy at a large”W” type chain I had brown Suede models some years back and uppers were a bit softer but the foot bed was still not wide enough. Returning.

customer_reviews.title: Horrible
customer_reviews.text: I don't know if I got some cheap knock offs or what, but these were easily the most uncomfortable and painful shoes I have ever worn. The inside of the shoe was hard as a rock, insoles were paper thin and did nothing, and inner middle parts of the shoes were unevenly high (one shoe higher than other). I went to an actual shoe store and got the brooks beast, and they feel amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Dylan S.

customer_reviews.title: Sizing was wrong - among other things
customer_reviews.text: I order my normal size which is 10.5 2E. The pair I received were way too small. I double checked the label to confirm I had the size I ordered. I managed to fit my foot into one shoe and other than the size, the insoles and arch support felt terrible. I have plantar fasciitis among other foot problems. I was hoping these shoes would help. Nope. Brooks is supposed to be a top of the line shoe brand. To me, they’re one of the worst.
customer_reviews.author: Stszejna

customer_reviews.title: Very slippery
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are very dangerous for wet surfaces. You will slip! They also run narrow.
customer_reviews.author: Denny Baux

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: Fell apart within a year. The toe/front portion is easily damaged and will not hold up to casual use. I no longer trust this brand and recommend you do not either.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Powers

customer_reviews.title: Worst Support Ever
customer_reviews.text: I've only been wearing these for 4 days and over that course of 4 days I've had the worst foot, knee, and back pain due to these shoes and the lack of good cushioning/support. The Brooks running shoes are amazing with great cushion and support, these walking shoes are horrible. Do not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Justin T. Poindexter

customer_reviews.title: cannot make these work any longer-the laces are crazy, I tie my shoes every 20 minutes-not kidding
customer_reviews.text: it seems like they just are not made the same-just little [but important changes] the laces are way to long, slippery-coming untied or slipping till they are loose-then the tongue starts shifting into crazy uncomfortable positions. Thing is-why do companies do this? "We have a great product-lets change everything" Then they just start cutting corners-Guess I will try Altras. Strange thing is-my first pair of Adrenalines-beat up as all get out-I put those on, and they still feel amazing-no tread, worn out. Why do companies change winning combination?
customer_reviews.author: Marcy Fox

customer_reviews.title: Better than the New Balance Men's MW577 Walking Shoe but at more than twice the price
customer_reviews.text: I replaced New Balance Men's MW577 Walking Shoes with this. The MW577 also come in a B width but are a tad wide around the balls of the feet. The Brooks Addiction Walker fit as a B width shoe is supposed to though at more than double the price. Time will tell how they wear but I'll come back and revise this review in half a year or so. It may be my imagination but my planar issue seems to be getting much better since wearing these shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne

customer_reviews.title: Not recommended.
customer_reviews.text: I wore these for about 8 weeks. They are sturdy and wear quite well, but I found them uncomfortable, and my feet would hurt after a few days of wearing them. I assumed that after my feet "adjusted", or the shoes "broke in", this would go away, but it never did. Even after giving it a rest for a week and trying them again. Do not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Allen

customer_reviews.title: So comfortable on sore arthritic feet.
customer_reviews.text: These without any doubt are the most comfortable shoes I have worn in years. I have had several other pairs of Brooks athletic type shoes which were good but nothing like these. I like these because they look dressier. These have a much thicker sole which really obsorbs the rough pavements etc. My feet hurt most of the time no matter what shoes i am wearing. These shoes feel truly like walking on air. They are definitely worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: M.A.Bommarito

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable Shoe that is Worth the Money
customer_reviews.text: I bought these after wearing a pair of entry level pair Rockport M7100's for about 6 months, which were already trashed. These do cost more than than the Rockports, and it is easy to see why. I have only had them a month, but they are so far wearing very well. I've been doing a lot of walking, these have been very kind to my crooked back. It's been years since I have had a pair of shoes that have fit so well (I wear Mens narrow, so shoes do not always fit as expected). The only flaw has been that the heel tends to slip, and I wish it was a tighter fit there. It hasn't affected function whatsoever.
customer_reviews.author: erikg

customer_reviews.title: I am on my feet for better part of 8 hours
customer_reviews.text: This is my 3rd pair in 3 years. I am on my feet for better part of 8 hours, doing on average 26000 steps in an 8 hour shift. The only reason I have given it 1 star less, is the front rubber tab on the toes (outside of shoe) always separates from the shoe. Very annoying, I would give it 5 stars every day if Brooks would get that fixed.
customer_reviews.author: Sasa Stankovic

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes!
customer_reviews.text: I was experiencing foot issues. I visited my podiatrist and the first thing she suggested was better footwear. Specifically she recommended Addiction Walkers. After purchasing a pair locally and wearing them for a couple days at work I returned to my doctor for a follow up visit. The very first thing in said to her was, “I didn’t know that my feet weren’t supposed to hurt!” These shoes are wonderful. The I just ordered two more pair to replace my worn out ones (shoes do wear out, even if they do not look like they are outwardly). These are the seventh pair I have owned. Do you and your feet a favor and take care of them with good footwear.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Magoomba

customer_reviews.title: Fit smaller than expected
customer_reviews.text: Returned. Comments here relate to the "brown suede" version of this shoe. First, it's too small for me; tighter in both width and length than expected. I can usually wear anyone's 10D, but not this one. I have the equivalent "black" version of this shoe, and its fit is excellent. Second, beware the "brown" color description and pictures. The shoe I received is more of a light cinnamon color, not at all the dark brown pictured in the Amazon images.
customer_reviews.author: James M

customer_reviews.title: Not what I expected for the price.
customer_reviews.text: After reading the reviews I got a sense that I should go with the wide because I normally wear wide shoes but I found these to be too wide. I still gave them a shot because they were very comfortable while walking around the house and I've never had problems with wide shoes before. I've had these for several weeks and while they are comfortable while standing and very light walking I find them to be uncomfortable when you put in over a mile in. I would not buy these again. On a good note. They look very well made and made out of good material.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Finally some relief from hurting feet.
customer_reviews.text: I have flat feet. I've used inserts before but still have terribly aching feet from standing all day. Brooks shoes are expensive but I finally gave it a shot and I am glad I did. Right away I can feel support in areas I've never felt with other shoes. I will now be wearing Brooks for the rest of my life. I only regret waiting so long to try them. Oh, they do run about a 1/2 size small, so get them in a half size bigger than you normally would and they should fit perfect. But if they don't fit you can return them.
customer_reviews.author: wheezer36

customer_reviews.title: Seems Well Built, but Squeaks
customer_reviews.text: I bought this shoe to wear at work. It's nice-looking, has good cushioning, and seems like a quality shoe. I returned the shoe because it made a squeaking noise when I walked. I sounded like Squidward. The squeak comes from where the tongue tucks into the upper part of the shoe; they are both smooth leather and squeak when they rub together. I put some silicone on the squeak and it helped for a while, but eventually the squeak returned.
customer_reviews.author: Randy

customer_reviews.title: These are fabulous
customer_reviews.text: My husband has a ton of back problems. He has had surgery, which failed and then on top of it all he was told that he needed knee surgery. He was at wits end and someone told him about these shoes. He was desperate and so we ordered them. These usually do not make any difference in how he feels and how he walks, but this pair was different. He wears them from the time he gets up to the time he gets ready for bed. He said he feels the support on the bottom of the shoe and he is able to walk without dragging his toes. I am totally willing to buy another pair.
customer_reviews.author: bg1

customer_reviews.title: My New Go to Shoes.
customer_reviews.text: Another shoe, I have worn for years, got redesigned and then, again and again, they kept adding 1,2, then 3 to model number, but after trying all the new versions, they were too narrow. I panicked as I had to find a new go to shoe company and shoe. Found Brooks and their Adiction Walker and once again all is right with the world. These met my needs for a wide stable diabetic friendly shoe. Thanks Brooks.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick L. Slavin

customer_reviews.title: The perfect shoes for serious walk-running (intervals)
customer_reviews.text: I’m a believer in a special shoe for each activity — walking, running and, in this case, walk-running (intervals). Shoes conform to the motion of your foot in a given activity. When I began interval training, I needed one pair of shoes that would suit for both running and walking — these shoes are outstanding! I’m serious about my intervals — both running and walking are at top or near-top speed. I learned that Brooks makes this shoe in the direct image of their corresponding walking — that convinced me and, from the first night of intervals, it was obvious this shoe is perfect for this activity.
customer_reviews.author: Scott B. Umstead

customer_reviews.title: Excellent shoe, well structured
customer_reviews.text: I like this shoe a lot. Very stable laterally, excellent walking shoe and walking is something I do for at least 2.5 miles per day on concrete. I compare the Addiction favorably to the Denham Exeter Low, which costs $60 more (and which I also like a lot). The Denham may (or may not) be a little more strongly structured, but I alternate between the two shoes happily. Both shoes are holding up well after three months of wear. On size, I wear a 9.5 or a 10 depending on shoe brand. For both Dunham and the Brooks Addiction the 10D is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Viajero

customer_reviews.title: Incredibly Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Wow. It’s been a long time since I’ve put on a shoe that was comfortable right from the start. This shoe is the most comfortable I’ve put on in over 20 years. Maybe longer. It’s a bit pricey but worth it. I wear a 15 4E and it fits well. I’ll update the review as I wear it for awhile. I hope it has some longevity. I’m actually thinking of buying a second pair and just sticking them in the closet to have when these wear out.
customer_reviews.author: John B

customer_reviews.title: This summer I had a bad time with pain
customer_reviews.text: I have a weak achilles tendon on one leg -- multiple ruptures, atrophied leg, etc. This summer I had a bad time with pain, swelling, etc. -- went on for months. These shoes (I have 2 pair now) help more than any other shoe I've ever had. Somehow it almost seems as though I'm not walking on my heel. I'd recommend them to anyone with similar problems. Now for an update a couple of years later -- having tried shoe after shoe, brand after brand, these are the only shoes I plan on repurchasing. The support, ease of walking, ability to exercise, etc. are not matched by any other shoe. Thank God these are available.
customer_reviews.author: Allen P. Chase

customer_reviews.title: GREAT Walking Shoes
customer_reviews.text: I have been wearing Brooks running shoes for years. I am not a runner so I figured I would try the walking shoes. When they came in they reminded me a little of the New Balance walking shoes. Let me tell you, New Balance walking shoes are like a Mazda compared to the Audi of shoes, Brooks. Buy with confidence. This is my 12th pair of Brooks shoes and they are so freaking comfortable. People on their feet all day, these are the way to go.
customer_reviews.author: Frank Registrato

customer_reviews.title: Pointed Toe Box
customer_reviews.text: Despite appearances in its images, the toe box turned out to be too narrow for my splayed toes. I'd even asked other buyers beforehand about the fit through the toes and was reassured the shoes were wide enough and comfortable. For me, they weren't --the shoe was too pointed-- and I'm going to be ordering me a pair of tried and true New Balance just as soon as I get credit for these too crimped Brooks.
customer_reviews.author: jettrink

customer_reviews.title: Very nice maybe half a size small
customer_reviews.text: Yo! Theyre good. although when i called the company on the phone i was like "hey bro what size should i get?". He recommended the same size as my other brooks glycerin size 12D. These felt too tight right away. They got looser over time and i might try some medieval tricks and make it wider. Probably shouldve got 12 1/2 D instead of 12D. I dont know man. I dont regret it though. I get around alot easier in these bad boys!
customer_reviews.author: Joshua

customer_reviews.title: Great Value and Comfortable Shoe
customer_reviews.text: I like to walk and this shoe is as comfortable as one twice as expensive. It has held up well and I expect to get normal life from this shoe. It is difficult for me to find shoes that fit for narrow feet but this one is perfect and is available in many widths and sizes. I use an orthopedic insole but this shoe has such great support that there has not been a need for the insole. As long as you don't need a fancy brand name shoe to show off, you'll love this one.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe for foot pain
customer_reviews.text: Went to the foot doctor for pain I was feeling in my ankle and he recommended getting a pair of these as well as custom shoe inserts which he ordered for me. I noticed an improvement right away. They are heavy and have no breathability so those would be the cons but the tradeoff is worth it for a reduction in pain. They also pair nicely with everything I wear at home or at work. They are expensive but worth the price. I liked them so much, I bought a second pair after the soles wore out on the first ones. I have never bought two pairs of the same shoe before. You can't get a better endorsement than that!
customer_reviews.author: Teddy F.

customer_reviews.title: Put over 30 miles on these in Europe
customer_reviews.text: Bought these walking shoes in anticipation of a 2 week trip to Europe. We spent time in Paris, Florence and Rome, walking miles and miles every day because it was low 70s and sunny every day! We feel like we went over 30 miles in 16 days. I LOVE these shoes!!! My feet were fine, walking was much easier than traditional shoes. Didn’t mind wearing them every day. I think part of the reason is they are slanted up a little which makes walking easier. And I could get these in 4E, size 9, so they fit perfectly. Highly recommended!!!
customer_reviews.author: MJ744

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I am on my feet, walking and standing all day. These shoes gave excellent support and were very comfortable. I should point out that I am a woman, my doctor recommended men's shoes for the taller toe box. The arch and ankle support were great. The drawback (and for me it is HUGE) these are not at all slip resistant in a restaurant setting. On wet tiles, I might as well be wearing roller skates. Because they are so comfy, I am going to look into some sort of hack to make them safer. Might not purchase this exact style again, but definitely within the brand.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Stephan

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Shoes!
customer_reviews.text: Due to heel issues, my podiatrist recommended Brooks shoes. I purchased these and couldn't be more pleased! No, they didn't "fix" my heels but these shoes sure made it less uncomfortable to walk for any length of distance. So far, they appear to be very durable and clean easily with a quick wipe with a damp cloth. Rain and water are not an issue. These shoes are not cheap but they were very much worth the price just for the comfort level they gave me. Even without hell issues, they would still be a great value with all-day comfort.
customer_reviews.author: Skip P

customer_reviews.title: BROOKS ADDICTION WALKERS = LIVE HAPPY!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these shoes because I knew BROOKS shoes won't let me down.I am on my feet all day working security at concerts,MLB,MLS,NFL,NCAA games and I have to have a shoe I can depend on for cushion,support and style....these BROOKS Addictions provide all of that. I've used other brands in the past but none of them compare .It was raining all day at while working a Soccer game and my Brooks Addictions weren't bothered a bit.I LOVE THESE SHO ES and would recommend them to all!
customer_reviews.author: Mike Puncsak

customer_reviews.title: Fits Well.  A Great Shoe!
customer_reviews.text: I am starting a seasonal temporary job with the USPS that will keep me on my feet for long stretches. Black leather shoes are required. While these shoes do not say “USPS Approved“, they are the highest rated such shoes for a reason. I have a wide size 13 foot now and finding a good fitting shoe is difficult. The Brooks Addiction Walker size 13 Wide (EE) shoe fits me well and is comfortable both to walk and stand in. There is a slight curve in the front of the sole that makes walking natural and easy. A great shoe!
customer_reviews.author: Craig D. Newhouse

customer_reviews.title: Ignore Brooks's advice: don't buy a half size too large!
customer_reviews.text: I wear a size 10 in New Balance. Brooks's website says that you should buy a half size larger than your regular shoe, so I ordered a 10.5. After a couple weeks of arch pain and the shallow heel slipping off of my foot, I returned them and went to a running shoe store when I was back in the U.S. After trying on a few pairs, I determined that a 9.5 was the right size for me. So much for "order a half size larger than normal"!
customer_reviews.author: Craig

customer_reviews.title: Most comfortable shoes I’ve owned.
customer_reviews.text: I got these because I have plantar fasciitis in one foot. I used to walk six miles several times a week and for the past year or so can’t do a half mile without pain. This is the only pair of shoes I’ve worn since they arrived. Lately I’ve walked up 3 miles and my hikes have been pain free. The change has to be due to the shoes. Although they aren’t stylish, they are very comfortable and have allowed me to start walking again. In fact, I’ve already bought a second pair.
customer_reviews.author: Robert R

customer_reviews.title: For those who work on concrete all day
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are definitely worth the price. It has all the support for those who are on the heavier side (like me) who work on concrete all day. Unfortunately I had to return these pair because they weren't the right size as I needed an 11 triple wide (or 11.5 double wide). S/N I had no idea how important it is to know your proper shoe size. I did purchase my correct size (the 11.5 double wide) and they've been glorious.
customer_reviews.author: JayCee087

customer_reviews.title: Most comfortable shoe in years
customer_reviews.text: This is the most comfortable pair of walking shoes I have purchased in a long time. I have rather narrow feet and always have a problem with the heals of my feet wearing out the inside backs of the shoes. I usually have to use inserts to make the shoes fit my heals and protect the shoes' liner from wearing out. These shoes are great and I hope Brooks continues to produce this model.
customer_reviews.author: Termite

customer_reviews.title: Feel comfortable and durable
customer_reviews.text: The shoes are comfortable, sturdy, and have nice arch support. They feel very well built and have good grip on the soles. They are a little heavy compared to running shoes, but these are specifically designed for walking so they prioritize comfort and durability over being lightweight. So far the only issue I've noticed is a small issue in the stitching near the tounge where the mesh from the inside of the shoe meets the leather on the outside (shown in the picture). Other than this slight issue I have had no problems with them so far.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Henault

customer_reviews.title: Not a comfortable shoe to wear in my case
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a comfortable shoe to wear while walking around Disney World for 6 days. This shoe did not fit the bill. I purchased a $120 pair of Brooks walking shoes. Wore them at Disney; they were the most comfortable pair of walking shoes I have ever owned in my 60+ years. I'm a New Balance fan, but their walking shoes, I tried several different models and returned all of them, fail to compare favorably with Brooks.
customer_reviews.author: JDDD

customer_reviews.title: I like Brooks Addiction shoes for two main reasons
customer_reviews.text: I like Brooks Addiction shoes for two main reasons. First, they have very strong support and are the most durable shoe I've found of this type. Second, they are sold in all black, so I can wear them to work. Note to athletic shoe companies--not all men want to wear women's/children's colors, most of which look ridiculous!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing shoe for someone who has large, wide, flat feet
customer_reviews.text: All my life I had resorted to buying the same style of Nike running shoe because my size 12, wide, flat foot would destroy other typical shoes. These Brooks though, they do the job right! I can walk and strand for so much longer than before without the pain that would plague me. They are not a 100% cure, and I didn't expect that from them. But the difference they have made in my daily life has been immense and I will gladly be buying this style of shoe for the foreseeable future!
customer_reviews.author: Ricardo A.

customer_reviews.title: Best support shoe made
customer_reviews.text: This brand was recommended by my foot Dr. as I have real foot problems. I've been purchasing this brand and style for some years and this is the only shoe I will wear. I have to pull out the arch support and place in my custom support which works perfectly. I recently recommended this shoe to a friend who has thanked me many times.
customer_reviews.author: Donald J. Shaw

customer_reviews.title: Nice walking shoes so far
customer_reviews.text: In the review I say the arch support is "moderate"....I have custom orthotics that I add to my shoes so I can only say that "with my orthotics" the arch support is great. They seem well made. I'm hoping they'll last at least a couple of months since running shoes now last only about a month for me before they start to hurt my feet. That includes the Brooks Beast and Ravenna. I've got my fingers crossed....had them only 2 weeks so we'll see how it goes.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry K.

customer_reviews.title: Squeaky walking shoes
customer_reviews.text: THESE SHOES SQUEAK! I've always bought Brooks running shoes so I convinced my husband to get these walking shoes. He's a USPS letter carrier and walks several miles a day so good footwear is very important. These shoes were a huge disappointment! The rubber tip at the toe of one shoe started peeling off within a couple of weeks, then the squeaking started. The left sneaker squeaks with EVERY STEP he takes. It is terribly annoying and we are basically throwing away a $120.00 pair of shoes. I would never recommend these and most likely won't buy Brooks again.
customer_reviews.author: Mimi7317

customer_reviews.title: Overrated
customer_reviews.text: I bought these because of the highly rated customer reviews. I really wanted to like them. Unfortunately, I don’t like them at all. The arch support is decent but my problem is the heel. There is absolutely no cushion and it feels hard as a rock. Wearing these shoes cause me horrible heel pain by the end of the work day. I’ve tried heel inserts but they don’t really work. I will be sticking with Vionics from now on and I won’t be purchasing these again
customer_reviews.author: Whitemule71

customer_reviews.title: Identical to New Balance Trail Walker
customer_reviews.text: These shoes seem fine, but it turns out they are as identical as it's possible to be to a pair of brown suede shoes I already have, New Balance Men's 779v1 Neutral Cushioning Trail Walking Shoe. Fit is the same and surface has only tiny differences in design and color. Plus, the New Balance is waterproof and these do not make that claim. New Balance on the left, this shoe on the right. I can't tell any difference with them on.
customer_reviews.author: reedsrx

customer_reviews.title: Most comfortable walking shoes I've found
customer_reviews.text: I bought these because I pronate, I have flat feet, and I love to walk. These are more comfortable for me than New Balance walking shoes. The Brooks Addiction Walking Shoes provide incredible support while still allowing my feet to flex naturally and comfortably. I also love that I can jog in them or even run a little without issues. The length is true to size, but as for width my foot falls in between a medium and a wide. The medium Brooks shoes were too narrow but the wide have worked out great. So, if you're in between widths, get the wider choice.
customer_reviews.author: Billy Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable walking shoe
customer_reviews.text: I walked in ASICS for years. Because they have a very supportive structure (which was a little different than my foot shape) I developed ankle and arch issues. I converted to a miminalist shoe for every day activities and these shoes for walking (average 3.5 mi/day). It took 10 months, but now my feet are pain free. These are durable, with a substantial sole. Not much tread though, so I would not use on slippery surfaces.
customer_reviews.author: douglas webb

customer_reviews.title: The shoe is comfortable and doesn't look bad at all
customer_reviews.text: The only reason I didn't give this 5 stars is due to time in the shoe. The shoe is comfortable and doesn't look bad at all. My initial walking in it have been good but I haven't walked a great distance in it yet. Fit is good. I typically wear a 14 but after getting another pair of Brooks I went with the wider shoe and that was better (even though I don't typically go with a wide shoe). The shoes were sent out and arrived quickly so no issues with the seller. Overall it's a good shoe so far. Time will tell how it holds up and how it makes my feet feel.
customer_reviews.author: Chanson

customer_reviews.title: Great Shoes
customer_reviews.text: Got these because my hubby had gotten a white pair of these and he loved them, but trashed them. So being the weather changing, decided to get black. Wish the brown wasn't suede! He said these seem a little tighter than the white. Bought the same size as the white so I don't see how, but that is what he claims. These shoes are great for him because he has a bad back and these are suppose to help. And they do. Highly recommend and will definitely buy again (white in the spring)
customer_reviews.author: M. Goldie

customer_reviews.title: Some "formal" shoes are more comfortable!
customer_reviews.text: Now, more than a year after my purchase, I can surely say that they are my worst running/walking shoes I've ever had. At least for my feet, with high arch and need of an orthopaedic insole. Fortunately I only bought 1 pair.
customer_reviews.author: Marcelo T.

customer_reviews.title: so have very difficult time finding shoes with the proper amount of arch support and padding to provide a stable and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I have rheumatoid arthritis, so have very difficult time finding shoes with the proper amount of arch support and padding to provide a stable and comfortable fit. This shoes is perfect. No additional inserts required. However, be careful to order the correct size. All my life I have worn a 9 or 9 1/2 C shoe. With this walker, my correct size is 8 1/2 EE. I have owned 5 pairs of this shoe with four being the white leather and this one the buffed brown leather. I was concerned the buffed leather would quickly scuff and show marks but my fears have proven unfounded. Excellent product.
customer_reviews.author: David B.

customer_reviews.title: Great for Active Walkers!
customer_reviews.text: The construction is quality - all leather uppers - fit is excellent, lining is again quality. I am a Sr. & always on the look out for shoes that fit well & support my active life style— these do that. I normally wear orthotics & have not used them with the Brooks. Pricing is commursate with comproable brands & models. I walk 2-5 miles/day & have enjoyed the foot support these provide — it just gets too easy to be sedentary... some reviews reported the laces were too short— I find them very adequate. Some reviewers reported the toe end-cap loosened— so get some Shoe-Goo... give your feet a treat & try these ! JBW
customer_reviews.author: Joseph B. Web

customer_reviews.title: No help for plantar fasciitis
customer_reviews.text: These were recommended to alleviate for plantar fasciitis. I was really hoping to love them, but unfortunately the pain was worse while wearing these - worse than any other shoes I own. Ugh
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Not for Severe cases of plantar fasciitis
customer_reviews.text: Although these shoes are comfortable, it is DEFINITELY not helping my plantar fasciitis. Also, the 4E wide is not as wide as it probably should be. I would compare these shoes to the New Balance ones that look identical and those are a bit cheaper and they are wide for a 4E as they should be. But in the end not a bad shoe, but I bought for helping my plantar fasciitis, which these are not helping with unfortunately.
customer_reviews.author: Hall

customer_reviews.title: With a cronic PF, my choices are limited. ...
customer_reviews.text: With a cronic PF, my choices are limited. So far, I am able to wear these WITHOUT an insert. I have a medium arch and normally wear superfeet copper inserts in my other shoes. If you hold the shoe in your hands and apply twisting pressure, you will find the sole is perfectly stable. Then, if you push front to back, only the toe area flexes upward. These are two handy test for PF suffers to do as a measure of how stable the platform is supporting your feet. Not the entire story (arch height is another) but a handy quick test which these shoes pass with flying colors.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Lutz

customer_reviews.title: Excellent shoes for the pronated
customer_reviews.text: After wearing them for 9 months I can say these are excellent shoes! I've been in NB's for a long time and wanted to try something different and I don't think I'll be going back. They are comfortable (even with my arch supports inserted), keep my feet feeling good and have held up better than any other shoe before and I wear them daily. Brooks is definitely my new brand and these are going to be the shoes I re-buy when these finally wear out.
customer_reviews.author: Gary W.

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable support that lasts longer than average.
customer_reviews.text: How many times do you put on a shoe and it is instantly comfortable? This is one of only two shoes that has ever happened with. This is my second pair, first pair lasted two years, and I do a lot of walking. (I commute by foot). A bit more expensive than many other shoes of its type, these are truly worth it.
customer_reviews.author: K. M. Cal

customer_reviews.title: Sore Feet, NO shock absorption
customer_reviews.text: I bought these shoes due to the reviews. I walk about 6.5 miles to 7.5 miles in a 5 hour period at work, depending on how busy it is. The shoes have support but NO cushion. My soles are sore and feel like they are on fire after work. If they had any kind of shock absorption they would be great. The soles are hard in not very flexible.
customer_reviews.author: Litercurious

customer_reviews.title: Exceedingly comfortable and stron shoe
customer_reviews.text: This is the most comfortable walking shoe I have bought in a long time. I use the shoe for city walking and routinely walk 5 miles per day, sometimes up to 10. After a month, I also bought a pair in black. I cannot say enough about them. I have narrow feet and the regular fits me fine. I recommend spraying the brown shoe with protector for rain and dirt before you use them because the suede finish is easier to stain or soil. Otherwise, I find them much more comfortable for walking than wearing conventional running shoes.
customer_reviews.author: J. Williams

customer_reviews.title: Very Comfortable!!!
customer_reviews.text: Haglunds Disease(Achilles Tendonitis,Bersidous Sack Tearing Achilles from the Heel and Calcium Deformity)in both feet causing pain and limited me from being on my feet very long. After a Couple of Months of Rehab from Surgery in April these Shoes were recommended. Much to my Surprise They're Light,Very Supportive and Very Comfortable. I ordered a pair Wider by one size and the fit is excellent. Not sure how long they'll last but it doesn't matter I will order a replacement pair whenever needed. No Regrets at all. Love Em.
customer_reviews.author: Sacrificial Lamb

customer_reviews.title: Toe section is cramped. Soles are slippery.
customer_reviews.text: Even though I ordered a half size larger than usual and a wide size, the toe section is cramped. I usually wear an 8 medium. I ordered a 8.5 wide. The shoe's soles are slick and dangerous on wet surfaces. I have worn them so I am stuck with them.
customer_reviews.author: Robert G. Oldroyd

customer_reviews.title: Best Walking Shoe Ever
customer_reviews.text: This was the fourth pair of these I have bought. I have kept every old pair for grunge work and actually wear the new ones to court and other important places. Very comfortable walking shoe. I just finished a two mile walk in my second to last pair which are still in excellent condition. Each pair seems to last about two years in every day use.
customer_reviews.author: Glenn

customer_reviews.title: In size and comfort matches my previous Brooks walking shoe
customer_reviews.text: This is an early review. I finally had to replace my 20 year old Brooks walking shoe. I ended up ordering the same size and width as I previously had. This shoe was faithful to size and width, and I am now in the process of breaking it in. I walk at the harbor here, so I use it for a few hours each day. It fits well and is comfortable, and hopefully it will hold up for a few years.
customer_reviews.author: R. Coleman

customer_reviews.title: Best Walking Shoe and I will Continue to Purchase
customer_reviews.text: Have purchased these walking shoes for both for me and my husband and have done so for many years as we walk many miles a week for exercise. They accommodate orthotics and is the best walking shoe I have found. My husband has very high arches and I have plantar fasciitis and flat feet but this shoe works for both of us. I hope they never stop making this shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Dobie

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe for walking
customer_reviews.text: I bought this after having foot problems and had a lot of pain walking. I bought it after reading reviews. I am a great fan of Brooks shoes. Served me well during my entire European Christmas vacation - treks through Christmas markets, Vatican, Colosseum, Brussels streets, Roman roads, and Amalfi coast were a walking treat.
customer_reviews.author: SanAntonio0901

customer_reviews.title: There aren't too many shoes you can put on out of the box and feel great, but...
customer_reviews.text: There aren't too many shoes you can put on out of the box and feel great. But these are the exception! This is my second pair. I've had these and Kuru and find the Brooks shoes are much better made. I've struggled with Plantar Fasciitis for some time and am now pain-free. Much of the credit goes to these shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes that don’t last.
customer_reviews.text: I loved these shoes. I’m on my feet all day so a shoe that looks great while providing excellent support was quite the find. I was planning to buy extra pairs in white and brown. After a couple months I found they weren’t supporting my feet as well. A few weeks later they started falling apart. The soles started separating from the uppers and they looked terrible. 3 months out of a $120 pair of shoes isn’t acceptable. Glad I didn’t buy the extra pairs. Sorry for the lack of pictures- I threw these away a while ago. Only writing because they were in my suggestions this morning.
customer_reviews.author: Bonej

customer_reviews.title: Toe is off the ground
customer_reviews.text: The shoes are of good quality. I have never worn walking shoes so what I don't like may be normal. My toe area doesn't sit on the ground making me feel like they may not be stable. walking across the living room making my foot roll enough for my the bottom of my toes to touch the ground the shoe is not thick enough in that area and my toes would get hurt or the shoe would wear quick in the toe area. Maybe that is how all walking shoes are. The shoes were returned.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cleaning out my closet and giving my "old styles" of shoes to Good Will. Cost a little more than other types ...
customer_reviews.text: Due to age and weight gain, my back, legs, and feet give me trouble. The Brooks Addiction shoes are just what I need. I need extra cushion and arch support. Also need the heel support because my ankles are weak and tend to pronate. Enables me to walk and keep flexibility. Cleaning out my closet and giving my "old styles" of shoes to Good Will. Cost a little more than other types of shoes, but well worth the cost.
customer_reviews.author: Rich

customer_reviews.title: In Between
customer_reviews.text: I returned the product because it was too small for me. I can usually wear a size 9D. There was nothing wrong with the shoe and quality, from appearance, was what I expected so I gave it 5 Stars. I received a credit from Amazon and re-ordered the shoe in size 9.5D. The 9.5D fit and after receiving the new pair I tested them out on my daily 2.3 mile walk. The feel was quite good.
customer_reviews.author: Leo

customer_reviews.title: Excellent shoes for those with pain in balls of feet
customer_reviews.text: I had been having a lot of trouble with pain in the balls of my feet. I tried several high end brands of athletic shoes with no luck at all. I also tried Dr. Scholl's gel implants which helped a little. After trying the Brooks Addiction shoes for a few weeks the pain went away. These shoes run true to size for a wide foot and look really nice. The shoes are well made and hold up well.
customer_reviews.author: Bulldog Engineer

customer_reviews.title: Have used/loved them for many years!
customer_reviews.text: Since starting to walk (and occasionally run) almost every day about 6 1/2 years ago, I've logged about 20,000 miles if you include general daily activity. I've gone though at least six pairs of Brooks Addiction Walkers (and even more running shoes) and continue to buy them. They're durable, comfortable, and a favorite of many people for many years. They'll be in my shopping cart again when the current pair wears out. I wouldn't recommend these for running (although they do okay), as they're heavier and stiffer than running shoes. But for walking or work on your feet, these shoes are terrific!
customer_reviews.author: DakotaDan

customer_reviews.title: Game Changer
customer_reviews.text: I have tried all kinds of shoes for work. The reviews are 100% true. These shoes take care of your feet. I have wide feet, high arch, and planter issues. These shoes allow me to be on my feet all day and have no pain what so ever. You know it is a good shoe when you see your mailman wearing them.
customer_reviews.author: Doug Hedin

customer_reviews.title: A bit clunky
customer_reviews.text: These shoes have enough space for my feet and don't come up at the heel like some do on me - I have a narrow heel and wide toes. I really like them so far, but I wouldn't say I love them. They provide good motion control and decent traction, but I am going to need to get longer shoelaces to be able to tie them to my satisfaction. Would probably be a lot less stiff with an insert, too. Hopefully with these two modifications, this pair will last me a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Wolf

customer_reviews.title: The proper fit is critical!
customer_reviews.text: While I have 3 pairs of the Brooks Men's Addiction Walking Shoe, THIS PAIR, THE NEWEST PAIR SQUEAK WHEN I WALK (and it is not me!). Make sure to try them on upon receipt (because I have multiple pairs of this shoe, I simply put them on a shelf) My mistake! R. Jury
customer_reviews.author: Richard Jury

customer_reviews.title: love, love, love Brooks
customer_reviews.text: I am so excited about this purchase. I got the Brooks Men's Addiction Walker Walking shoes by Brooks. They are exactly what I wanted and need. I am going to save them for dresser occasions and just keep wearing my Brooks Beast Walking shoes. I am extremely satisfied with this purchase as I am with all my Brooks purchases. Thank you Brooks for producing a product for us flat-footed people who had to just endure pain wearing shoes for normal feet.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy Beatty

customer_reviews.title: So I hoped these would be super comfortable and would not rub his scar
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my 81 year old father with flat feet - also having a scar on his leg/ankle from the vein that had to be used in his cardiac bypass graft. So I hoped these would be super comfortable and would not rub his scar. He hates shopping for himself and swore up and down that his 15 year old tennis shoes were fine. Then I brought these over and he really likes the way these shoes fit. So mission solved! Dad got a new pair of shors he will wear!
customer_reviews.author: FAMILY OKAT

customer_reviews.title: My husband has worn Brooks Addiction Walking shoes for several ...
customer_reviews.text: My husband has worn Brooks Addiction Walking shoes for several years and has always worn the same size and width. When I ordered this new pair for him and he tried it on, it was definitely too small and he would need a whole size larger. The width was the same. He really likes the make and style of shoe and would have given it a 5 star if the shoe fit.
customer_reviews.author: Carla D

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable but not durable
customer_reviews.text: The shoes were comfortable as promised but not durable. I have bought many high quality good rated shoes. All of them ran for considerable long time and almost without any normal wear and tear. This is the first shoes which developed 1-2 cm long cut within 9-10 months of usage. I wanted to become fan and keep buying but now not anymore. It seems quality is the issues here. They are comfortable, goes well with office causals but not durable.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Holds up well on long walks, great cushion, fits as expected
customer_reviews.text: Great shoe for anyone who walks long miles across moderate terrain. One of the best offerings for those in need of all-leather uppers in a low-cut athletic shoe. Holding up well through 3 weeks of heavy use, walking upwards of 12 miles in 90-100+ degree heat at a time. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: --jl--

customer_reviews.title: Great for plantar fasciitis
customer_reviews.text: My foot doctor told me about these shoes. I’ve been wearing the black ones for a few years now. Comfortable well-made shoes. I do wish they would make a brown leather shoe. These are suede... with a big (1.5”) black heel. Fine for casual use but not for the boardroom.
customer_reviews.author: S. Brusco

customer_reviews.title: A Welcome surprise
customer_reviews.text: I actually ordered these shoes thinking they were a Propet product (since that was what I searched for!) Only realized after I ordered and the name Propet appeared nowhere in the order. I am pleasantly surprised at how comfortable they feel, although I have only worn them a few days. I usually wear a 6E New Balance shoe, but NB seems to have stopped making them this wide. In the future, I will certainly look for Brooks shoes.
customer_reviews.author: R. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Low durability
customer_reviews.text: I heard nothing but good about Brookes so decided to try for the first time. The problem is not how they fit but rather the durability. I paid $120 for these because they came with good reviews but in less than 4 months the stiching is coming apart and now I have to pay a shoe repair man even more now just to sew them back together. And that’s not even from wearing them everyday! Big time disappointment!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommended
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a black pair, 10.5 D. I usually wear a 10 D but wanted a little extra space for heavier socks and for when my feet expand a bit while walking distances. The fit is perfect. I have very flat feet and overpronate badly, along with frequent heel and plantar pain and inflammation. I can feel the extra stability these give me. I've been having pretty bad achilles tendon pain recently, even with my orthotics, but after several walks using these shoes and my orthotics and I haven't had any of this. I highly recommend them. I just bought a 2nd pair, in white.
customer_reviews.author: McFlip

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for me and my flat feet
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE THESE SHOES!!!! I am 6'2.... about 420 lbs.... and have flat feet. I purchased size 14 EE I have always bought shoes around the $50 range and thought they were ok... I did tons of research, and decided to spend a little extra to keep my feet alive. Soft, comfortable and better than I expected. Feet are no longer hurting when I get home from work and I couldn't ask for more!!!! I am doing a lot more after work walking to get my weight down.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny M

customer_reviews.title: Real Addiction
customer_reviews.text: My work commute to NYC involves 3 to 4 miles of walk. Size 9 4E. It fits my wide feet so perfectly and I started feeling very comfortable after a weeks walk with these shoes. Yes, they are becoming real addiction as the days progress. Used other brands earlier for walking like New Balance, Clarks... These shoes are built to last long. Improvements/suggestions: I found little slippery on wet/smooth surfaces. Can make look more trendy (exterior)
customer_reviews.author: Venkat Mannepalli

customer_reviews.title: It's nice to walk without pain.
customer_reviews.text: I recently got a new job that required a lot more walking. I have tendon issues and the extra walking ended up causing great pain. My foot Dr. was always recommending brooks so I figured I would try them. I did not want a running shoe and decided to buy these after reading that this shoe was popular with postmen. Very happy to say that they helped relive most of my pain and the few months I've been wearing them have became even more comfortable. I wear them for work only but after switching back from my non work shoes I wonder why I don't wear them all the time. I need to get another pair...
customer_reviews.author: Pete DeLeewerk

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as the reviews stated
customer_reviews.text: I've had these shoes for almost a year and I am not very impressed. The soles are all ready starting to get worn down and my feet generally hurt everyday when I get home from work. When I wear my old tennis shoes, my feet don't hurt. And yes, I do wear my old shoes now. I bought these shoes because of the great reviews, but I'm just not seeing the stellar product that I expected. I wouldn't recommend or buy these again.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Phile

customer_reviews.title: My favorite shoe since 2010
customer_reviews.text: I discovered these shoes online back in 2010 while searching for a more comfortable shoe for my often-sore feet. I have to wear therapeutic arch supports in my shoes, and have problems finding shoes that would give me the support I needed and still be comfortable at all times. I am now on my sixth pair of these and will probably continue to buy them until someone can show me a better shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good fit on first time order.  Decent quality.
customer_reviews.text: My foot is wide with a high instep and I've long had difficulty purchasing shoes that fit off the shelf locally but I hate purchasing footwear on-line. These shoes are a nice surprise. Made in China but quality appears decent and fit well and are wide enough for my duck feet. I would like a bit more cushion in the sole and to be able to purchase USA made or from an Ally but that would cost me an additional 200 or 300 bucks.
customer_reviews.author: Lario

customer_reviews.title: Great for pronaters, big guys
customer_reviews.text: "Brooks Men's Addiction Walkers" are my go-to work shoes / dress shoes. All day comfort for pronaters who spend much of the day on their feet. While the exterior of the shoe wears well, as a big guy (320 lbs), I end up replacing the shoes every 6-9 months, because the support features of the shoes have broken down. If you're looking for a comparable experience in a sneaker, try the "Brooks Beast."
customer_reviews.author: Wrypeter

customer_reviews.title: I used to have terrible foot pain and these solved it
customer_reviews.text: This is my fourth pair. They last about two years with daily use. I used to have terrible foot pain and these solved it. Great shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Gould

customer_reviews.title: Not like other Brooks shoes
customer_reviews.text: I have several pairs of Brooks shoes and they are great. The minute you put them on they're comfortable and you're ready to go. I was looking forward to this pair and when I opened the box they looked great. But when I tried them on they just didn't feel right. I thought maybe a casual shoe might need more break in than a running shoe so I wore them an hour or so around the house. Sadly, there wasn't any improvement so I returned them.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Barker

customer_reviews.title: Brooks Addiction Walker
customer_reviews.text: I have a narrow foot and the Brooks Addiction Walkers fit me great. For years I had bought another major brand, but something changed and they no longer fit me. These were last years model, but I did not care for the way the new ones looked. Besides, these were nearly half the price.
customer_reviews.author: R. Bobrowski

customer_reviews.title: They SQUEAK enough to makes you a joke at work!
customer_reviews.text: These shoes seem great at first, but after a couple of months they start to squeak when you walk and the squeak gets louder and louder with each use. And, this pair's soles are starting to fall off after 6 months of mild use. I was once a fan of these shoes, but no longer.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen A. Ragusea

customer_reviews.title: Comfort and durability
customer_reviews.text: Most comfortable walking shoe for heavy person I've had maybe ever. Wear them everywhere, but 15 to 20 miles a week regular walking/slow jogging. PROS: excellent fit, stable platform, slightly higher uppers, cushioning for heavy person. CONS: short shoelaces, sole beginning to separate around toe after considerable abuse, slightly stiff, a bit heavy. But pros far outweigh cons at this point. Brooks? Who knew after being a fan of another brand for last 40 years.. Change can be good.
customer_reviews.author: Tycho

product_meta.title: Brooks Men's Addiction Walker Nordic Walking Shoes
product_meta.description: With the new Addiction Walker you will have the fit and feel of a running shoe in a casual walking shoe, which now also has an adaptive shock-absorbing midsole in BioMoGo DNA that allows the return of energy, a softer upper in full-grain leather , a strong support and a reliable non-slip sole. It will offer you strength and support kilometer after kilometer, supporting your feet from the low arch and keeping your pronation under control. The Addiction Walker is also available with V-STRAP fasteners - identical to the version with laces, but with the convenience of the Velcro closure to wear them in a flash. Weight 397 gr.
